    • onClose

      public boolean onClose()
      Called whenever the menu is closed by the player either by clicking the close button or by closing the inventory with escape.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the menu should skip closing logic and return to the parent menu. Returns false if the menu should proceed with closing logic.
      API Example:
      public boolean onClose() {
        if (this.getParent() != null) {
          this.getParent().open();
          return true;
        }
        return false;
      }
      API Note:
      This method is called when a menu is closed by a plugin using player.closeInventory(). This could lead to Stack Overflows if not handled properly.

    • getParent

      public AbstractGUIMenu getParent()

    • syncClose

      public void syncClose()
      This is a VERY important method. I discovered (through a lot of pain, trial, and error.) that when closing an inventory using owner.closeInventory() inside the handleClick method, the inventory is closed asynchronously causing an error to be thrown. If you ever should close an inventory inside the handleClick method, you must use this method to avoid all possible errors.
      API Note:
      Note 1: I'd just like to make a note that these asynchronous closing errors only happen when right-clicking in a slot greater than 45. WHY? I have no clue, NMS is weird sometimes. My best guess would be that it tries to do stuff in the player inventory, since closing an inventory opens the player inventory. This is some deep NMS stuff but the player inventory has 45 slots. I'm just assuming that's what is happening although I could be wrong. This is more of an explanation of the above error, but you should still use this method to close inventories despite being in a slot below 45.
      Note 2: The open method already accounts for this error, so you shouldn't have to call this method before using the open method. Basically, you should try to replace the owner.closeInventory() method with this method.
